title: More than 30 gems for Joomla 4 I can't live without
excerpt: There are also many extensions out there which are less known than the ones listed on the JED, for example because they are only available on Github. description: I am always very happy to pay Developers for Joomla Extensions because they deserve it. Some extensions are widely known because they are available on the Joomla! Extensions Directory™ https://extensions.joomla.org  and have excellent reviews. But there are also many gems out there which are less known, for example because they are only available on Github. In this session I want to share with you my own list of those little extensions that I use on most of my Joomla 4 websites, together with a few tips & tricks. The vast majority of these extensions are open source (in which case I encourage you to contribute!) or at least free of charge. I have gathered them in 8 themes.

speaker: Tim Davis
title: SmarterThanTims
excerpt: A panel of Joomla Rockstars...
description: Building a website in a language you're not familiar with can feel like a daunting task. But fear not! In this session, Stefan Gagner will show you the ropes and teach you how to create a multilingual Joomla website with ease. You'll leave feeling confident and ready to take on any multilingual website project! What does it take to build a successful website with over 740,000 episode plays? Join Vinnie Hebert as he shares his top Joomla extensions that helped him create the popular site ILoveOldTimeRadio.com. Learn from the hero himself and take your own Joomla site to new heights! Don't let internet and power outages slow down your Joomla site building progress. Troy Hall has a solution for you! In this session, he'll introduce you to Bearsampp, a powerful tool that allows you to work on Joomla sites offline from your own computer. Say goodbye to frustration and hello to productivity! As Joomla 3 approaches its sunset, it's time to reflect not only on the platform but also on our own lives. Join Joe Sonne and Tim Davis as they share their experiences as "later years" Joomlers and discuss how to achieve a better balance between Joomla and real life. Don't miss this insightful and thought-provoking session!

speaker: Nicholas Dionysopoulos
title: Site Wars: The Phantom Menace
excerpt: Site owners are afraid their site will be brought down in an instant by a malicious actor. But fear is the path to the Dark Side. Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering. Learn how to stay safe and maintain a secure site, identifying your security priorities, putting into perspective the vulnerabilities discovered in your CMS and its software, and avoiding the common bad choices popularized by those who are afraid and don't know better.

speaker: Yannick Gaultier
title: Podcasting with Joomla
excerpt: Using a Joomla custom field generated by a new extension, 4Podcast, it is now super-easy to run one (or several) fully featured podcasts from your Joomla website.
description: Using a Joomla custom field generated by a new extension, 4Podcast, it is now super-easy to run one (or several) fully featured podcasts from your Joomla website. This can be "just" a podcast or, as we do at weeblr.com, combining a blog with a podcast. Providing your content as a podcast enhances your reach as the podcast can then be made available through all major podcasting platforms (Apple, Google, Spotify, Pocket Casts, iHeart, ...). Creating and maintaining a podcast is also much easier than a video blog for instance. With proper Structured Data automatically generated, this can also increase your content visibility in Google. We'll go through the main features of the extension and then quickly set up a live podcast.

speaker: Phil Walton
title: Have your say on how the Joomla 5 website design will look and feel
excerpt: With Joomla 5 Just over 6 months away we are planning the colours, design and everything to do with the Joomla landscape.
description: With Joomla 5 Just over 6 months away we are planning the colours, design and everything to do with the Joomla landscape.This is a session devoted to presenting early ideas and getting community feedback so we can produce an attractive, practical, accessible and fun design and build for the Joomla websites (joomla.org, community.joomla.org, developer.joomla.org) which will in turn inform the Marketing look and feel.

speaker: Kilian Valkhof
title: Beyond responsive design: new and future media queries
excerpt: What responsive design means for your development workflow and how you can use these capabilities to provide a better experience for your users and truly respond to their preferences.

speaker: Vlad Georgiev
title: The Hosting Quo & How to Break Free From Your Hosting Provider in 2023
excerpt: Fully Managed cloud clusters for super busy websites - global high availability at scale.
description: 1. How has the hosting industry been operating since it was born - No freedom – tied to the software/features available with a specific provider only - No multi-cloud options – tied to the infrastructure/servers of one provider only - No green hosting options with most hosting providers - Why freedom is important and the advantages of having options to choose and build your hosting solution from scratch (select cloud providers, select software, select management)   2. Top web hosting industry trends - Multi-cloud hosting - Green web hosting - Fewer data centers (traditional data centers are decreasing as people move to cloud) - Managed web hosting services - Speed and security (importance of Core Web Vitals, site optimization for speed, usability. Security – HTTPs as the norm, every important/growing website on its own server)   3. The next step in the hosting evolution - true freedom, control and flexibility. - Users voice will lead the transformation of the industry (total democracy as we did with features.spanel.io allowing users to build SPanel by voting) - From regional hosting providers to global all-in-one SaS hosting solutions

speaker: Dan Dascalescu
title: Adding AI-powered semantic search to your Joomla site - Google for your own data
excerpt: Ever wished your Joomla site could deliver Google-like search results to its users? This is now possible using open source AI-powered semantic search engines, like Weaviate.
description: Ever wished your Joomla site could deliver Google-like search results to its users? This is now possible using open source AI-powered semantic search engines, like Weaviate. After indexing your Joomla data (text/audio/video), Weaviate can “understand” user intent in search queries and it can answer questions, returning more relevant results than simple keyboard-based searches. Weaviate is open source and can be deployed alongside your Joomla instance, or can be used as a hosted solution.
